page.title: 14SANDY BAY DAY OUT.
page.content: We left the coach and met Mr. Freestone at the Country Life Museum. There were 3 sixth formers there to take a group.First we had to find Sandy Bay beach.When we got there,the 6th formers went along the clifftop,we went along the beach.After a while, we sat down and were told what to do.Mark had to walk along the first tide line and record the litter he saw.Denise and Elizabeth tried to find seashore creatures.Tom and I went with Mr. Freestone to find some types of plants,we took a plant book.The three most common plants were Plantain, Horsetail and Bramble.There was one plant that we didn't know and wasn't in the plant book.We had our lunch at Orcombe Point and afterwards, some of us went swimming.At 2.30, we had to walk back to school.When we got back,we were very tired.
